abstract.text: Publish an article to your channel.

You exceeded the number of articles that can be published within the allowed time window. The response header
indicates the time in seconds you need to wait before sending a new request to publish articles.
Use the Create an Article endpoint to publish an article to your channel.
Here are the guidelines for Apple News Format documents and resources:
A Create an Article request must consist of at least one
part that contains the article’s Apple News Format document. This part must have filename set to
. See “Example Code for Creating an Article Without Metadata” below.
The server requires additional parts for each resource referenced in the Apple News Format document that uses a
in this format:
Each part must have a
header. The disposition must be form-data, and you must specify the filename parameter of
In resource parts, the filename parameter must match the path of the
in the Apple News Format document that references this file. For example, if the document references a URL of
, there must be a
part with filename set to
. For resource parts, the valid values for
are
, and
When using a remote image, the URL must be in
or
format. No additional parts are required in the URL for remote images.
See
to learn how to publish an article using the Apple News API.
Here are the guidelines for Apple News Format metadata:
You can include an optional metadata part to provide additional non–Apple News Format data about the article, such as
and
. See
. The metadata part can also specify any sections for the article by URL.
You must wrap all metadata fields in a data key. See “Example Code for Creating an Article with Metadata” below_._ The
error is thrown if there is no
key in the request call.
Here are the guidelines for Apple News Format sections:
To publish the article to the channel’s default section, omit
To get information about a specific section, such as the section ID, use the
endpoint.
To publish a standalone article outside of sections, set
to
(an empty array). Standalone articles don’t appear in your channel, but still appear in topics and search results, and may appear in For You.
Here are general guidelines for Apple News Format:

For articles with a source URL or thumbnail, avoid posting more than one article on the same channel using the same title, source URL, or thumbnail, within a 24-hour period. An article is considered a duplicate if these conditions are met.

For articles without a source URL and thumbnail, avoid posting more than one article on same channel, using the same title, within a 24-hour period. An article is considered a duplicate if these conditions are met.
When you create an article, be sure to retain the article ID or the self URL that’s returned in the response. You need the article ID to read, update, and delete an article.
To publish older articles, use the metadata properties in Apple News Format. If you set an older publication date, the article appears earlier in the feed. See
in Apple News Format documentation. Articles are sorted by publication date.
A canonical URL is required to do data collection and reporting for comScore analytics.
Don’t change the canonical URL of the article after it has been set.

content.text: Example Code for Creating an Article Without Metadata

code: "subtitle": "A look at the features of the News iOS app",
"text": "The Apple News Format allows publishers to craft beautiful editorial layouts. Galleries, audio, video, and fun interactions like animation make stories spring to life."
"subtitle": "A look at the features of the News iOS app",
"text": "The Apple News Format allows publishers to craft beautiful editorial layouts. Galleries, audio, video, and fun interactions like animation make stories spring to life."

abstract.text: Learn about the new features and deprecated fields in Apple News API.

doc://com.apple.applenews/documentation/.title: Apple News API Release Notes for iOS 17, iPadOS 17, and macOS 14

abstract.text: Request channel data and publish an article using the Apple News API.
Change the information that News displays about your published article.

doc://com.apple.applenews/documentation/.title: Changing the Appearance of Your Article Tile in Feeds

abstract.text: Plan the design for your article and create it in Apple News Format.
Build a URL and article body for the publish-article request.
Publish and manage Apple News Format articles.
See the fields the article endpoints returned.
See the required field for the Create an Article request.
See the links the article endpoints returned.
See which objects make up the Create an Article, Read an Article, and Update an Article responses.
See the optional metadata fields for the Create an Article Request.
Delete the specified article from your channel.
See the properties of an error the Apple News API returned.
Retrieve information about an article, such as the revision number and maturity rating.
See a list of all articles in a channel that match the specified search criteria.
Get information about the specified section, including its name, its channel, and whether it’s a default section.
See a list of all articles in a section that match the specified search criteria.
See the object that wraps the throttling information that’s returned for the Create an Article and Read an Article endpoints.
Update an existing article in your channel.
Publish an article to your channel.
See the fields the search article endpoints returned.
See the object that wraps the throttling information that’s returned for the Create an Article and Update an Article endpoints.
See the metadata fields for the Update an Article request.
Information about your article, including author name, creation date, publication date, keywords, and excerpt.
